Well, it kind of is relevant as it could change whether the client lib takes that size as a parameter or it is done in some other way. Ideally, the client itself would just check the size of what it's uploading and do the appropriate thing. Since the size parameter so far has been marked as deprecated and only there for backwards compatibility, I don't think we want to add usage of that arg unless we know for sure that it is what we want."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-09-25 18:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review -Workflow

Removing my vote while this is worked on.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-10-08 18:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28948, 'date': '2018-10-17 15:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Eric Yes, the default chunk size of ceph is 8MB, thanks for correcting me on this. I did an experiment, when upload 1GB volume to image with ceph as backend, this patch can save about 30% time.

My environment:
1. CPU: Xeon E5 72 cores, Memory: 32G, DDR4, Disk: 500G SSD
2. openstack and ceph are installed in the same machine
3. ceph just configured 1 osd and 1 mon.

I believe this patch can save more time if ceph installed in a separate machine, because the time of convey 8 MB data should not have much difference with convey the resize command in production environment which may with 40Gbps or 100Gbps network. Also, this patch may can save more time if ceph with more osd, because "resize" is "read-and-then-write", but write data just "write".

[{'created': '2018-09-14 08:33:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix uploading cinder volumes to images

When uploading a volume to glance as an image, the glance server don't
know the image size, so the backend storage server(such as ceph) need to
resize the image every time it received new chunk of data(by default
64K). So there will be huge times of resize operations that will terribly
impact the performance. The patch aims to tell the image size to glance
server at the initial phase of uploading, so that glance backend such as
ceph can allocate an image with exact size, and don't need to resize the
image again and again

Task: 26466

commit_message:
Specify image size to avoid glance backend resize

When uploading a volume to glance as an image, the glance server don't
know the image size, so the backend storage server(such as ceph) need
to resize the image every time it received new chunk of data(by default
64K). So there will be huge times of resize operations that will
terribly impact the performance. The patch aims to tell the image size
to glance server at the initial phase of uploading, so that glance
backend such as ceph can allocate an image with exact size, and don't
need to resize the image again and again

Closes-Bug: #1792710
Change-Id: Ifd461c058fbd34934c407a1fc39403bd205b8009

The sheer act of registering the 'use_tpool' option seems to be enough
to cause the following warning:

   NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not
   supported

Add it to the list of ignored opts, thus silencing this warning.

commit_message:
Ignore 'use_tpool' option

The sheer act of registering the 'use_tpool' option seems to be enough
to cause the following warning:

   NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not
   supported

Add it to the list of ignored opts, thus silencing this warning.

Change-Id: I4a5f8958c3e0fc68fa3a4ae979f284c4fbd9b82b
(cherry picked from commit 698c62702af8f9ccca574a7ad714d3ae1298a5a8)

[{'created': '2018-10-16 17:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix crashing `BasicAuth` context manager

When `BasicAuth` object is used as a context manager, it crashes
on `__exit__` because of missing `.close()` method. This patch
fixes that and adds a bunch of test cases.

Change-Id: I3d8612dfb481d29fb56cec1012c906e37ed911a9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix crashing `BasicAuth` context manager

When `BasicAuth` object is used as a context manager, it crashes
on `__exit__` because of missing `.close()` method. This patch
fixes that and adds a bunch of test cases.

Change-Id: I3d8612dfb481d29fb56cec1012c906e37ed911a9

commit_message:
logging: fluentd deprecated params releasenote

LoggingSources & LoggingGroups will not be supported in the future.

LoggingSources: For adding logging sources to fluentd add the
 parameter fluentd:tripleo_fluentd_sources_{{service_name}} to the
 service_config_settings section

LoggingGroups: For adding logging sources to fluentd add the
 parameter fluentd:tripleo_fluentd_groups_{{service_name}} to the
 service_config_settings section

This patch is a follow-up to:
Depends-On: I28028ffa00df2da8e0478a551d3de89c3ee46e1f

Change-Id: I0be18719a3426c0570f507edfc229e6ba7af7597

commit_message:
[Functional] Increase test_timeout for db migration tests

In Neutron we hit quite often same issue as Manila, see [1] for
details.
It looks that solution for this problem may be increase timeout
for test_walk_version functional tests.
Higher timeout will be applied for tests for both pgsql and mysql
backends but it is mostly needed for mysql because 'pymysql' works
much slower on slow nodes than 'psycopg2'

This patch adds also new decorator to set individual timeout for
tests.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1501272

Change-Id: I5f344af6dc3e5a6ee5f52c250b6c719e1b43e02d
Closes-Bug: #1687027

commit_message:
Prioritize external networks for assigning FIP to instance

When we assign floating ip to the instance, take note of what's defined
in clouds.yaml regarding network layout in the target cloud, and only fall
back to the existing behaviour if configuration makes no sense.

Change-Id: I808bad9392c333003a05acf8eb1d9268ebaf9335

messages:
[{'account_id': 26558, 'date': '2018-02-09 01:55:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-09 01:55:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-02-09 02:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-02-09 03:28:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25674, 'date': '2018-02-09 03:41:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

small fixes and you may want to look into making all of your comments a little more uniform as far as whitespace is concerned.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-09 15:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)

Thank you for the patch, excellent patch in general. I've left some comments inline.... sorry for the boiler-plate copy/paste nature of them - we've got some work coming soon that should reduce that.

I'm not sure what's wrong with the bifrost job - will have to look in to that - I doubt it's related to this patch.

Also - we should add a functional test job that has a senlin-enabled devstack. I think we can do it as a followup, but if you feel like exploring that, check out the shade-functional-devstack-magnum job in .zuul.yaml as an example to work from. If you do, make sure to add a "SHADE_HAS_SENLIN: 1" variable to the tox_environment of that job, then add an entry to the scenarios in shade/tests/functional/test_devstack.py'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-09 15:42:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Oh, piddle. Forgot to leave an actual review vote. Get those other comments cleaned up and we can get this landed.

Also - totally forgot in the last comment ... could you please add a release note? If you haven't done that before, the 'reno' tool is used - so 'reno new added-senlin-support' will create a new release note file and tell you where it is. Then edit that and remove the sections that aren't 'features' and leave a note. Doesn't have to be long - 'Added support for senlin' would be fine."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-12 12:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Bailey.'}, {'account_id': 26558, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-02-12 18:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-14 15:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

Looking great (most of those test failures are not related to this patch)

A few more comments inline - the one about time.sleep is the most important.'}, {'account_id': 26558, 'date': '2018-03-22 19:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26558, 'date': '2018-03-22 19:55:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26558, 'date': '2018-03-22 21:09:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-27 11:34:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

Looking good. there's one more thing with your new wait loops. I'm just going to push up an edit on the patch with that taken care of (easiest way to explain)"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-27 12:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-30 11:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-07 00:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The tests are failing because senlin forcefully reinstall all dependencies, essentially re-writing certifi (removing the devstack tls cert patch)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-07 01:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Pretty sure this patch should fix the SSL issues
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566487/

> /opt/stack/senlin/devstack/lib/senlin:install_senlinclient:195 :   pip_install --upgrade --force-reinstall python-senlinclient'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-05-07 03:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-06-19 18:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-06-19 21:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-06-21 18:01:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I shifted this over to openstacksdk - we should land it over there and then get that to flow in to shade.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/576650/

If anybody has time to add some docstrings, I think that's the last blocker."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-17 15:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Adds Senlin support to shade

Adds Senlin API to shade, along with unit and functional tests for each
Senlin function. Allows shade to create, list, get, update and delete
clusters, cluster policies, cluster profiles, and cluster receivers.
Also allows for attaching and detaching policies to clusters, updating
policies on clusters, and listing policies on clusters.

Change-Id: I75fca341b7bc9e63f3cf18f4a0bdb6696cd5bfc6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 17:49:15.000000000', 'message': "Add recreate test for bug 1798163

Change Icae5038190ab8c7bbdb38d54ae909fcbf9048912 in Rocky
attempts to online migrate missing consumers table records
when listing allocations for a given resource provider. The
problem is when it's doing an insert-from-select, it's not
handling multiple allocations on the same provider for the
same consumer, like you'd have with a compute instance that
has VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB allocations against a single
compute node resource provider. As a result, the insert
statement has duplicate consumer IDs in it which results in
a unique constraint violation.

The existing tests never caught this because they tested with
3 unique consumers with a single allocation each.

Change-Id: Iba56aa6b227b6455d2437e4fabcd296b1b0f06ee
Related-Bug: #1798163
"}, {'created': '2018-10-16 18:16:12.000000000', 'message': "Add recreate test for bug 1798163

commit_message:
Add recreate test for bug 1798163

Change Icae5038190ab8c7bbdb38d54ae909fcbf9048912 in Rocky
attempts to online migrate missing consumers table records
when listing allocations for a given resource provider. The
problem is when it's doing an insert-from-select, it's not
handling multiple allocations on the same provider for the
same consumer, like you'd have with a compute instance that
has VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB allocations against a single
compute node resource provider. As a result, the insert
statement has duplicate consumer IDs in it which results in
a unique constraint violation.

The existing tests never caught this because they tested with
3 unique consumers with a single allocation each.

The functional test added here hits both online data migration
routines: via the API when listing allocations for a resource
provider and the direct online data migration CLI.

Change-Id: Iba56aa6b227b6455d2437e4fabcd296b1b0f06ee
Related-Bug: #1798163

commit_message:
Don't expose endpoint URLs in the login form

Instead of using endpoint URLs to designate regions in the login
form and its cookies, use numbers. This way, if internal URLs are
configured, they won't be exposed to the outside.

Change-Id: Ifed089e7cee3075bf2dc5d1ce77b0e1b1d091ca0
Closes-bug: #1787943

commit_message:
Add nodepool functional tests

nodepool has a functional test that checks against master of shade, but
shade does not have the inverse. The recent issue with os-client-config
would have been caught if we'd had this in place.

Change-Id: Ic416f56cc675a7873750221e91a85adeb687543c
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/566387

commit_message:
Ignore 404 errors while fetching paginated volumes

When we get a volume list, it's possible for a volume to disappear
causing the pagination to bork. Return what we can.

Change-Id: I3c2ab35f5d2a7f08ae7e1cd42bc00ff05dc18af9

commit_message:
Add subnetpool_name_or_id parameter to create_subnet

create_subnet already have partial support for subnetpools,
as it supports the parameter use_default_subnetpool.
However, it's not good enough for us, as we have multiple
allocation pools to choose from.

Arguably, task #6177 should have been done first, this
implementation does some direct API calls instead of shade
methods.  Arguably, full support for subnetpools is outside
the scope of shade; "If you want to do complicated things,
you should probably use the lower level client libraries -
or even the REST API directly."

Quite some work has been put down in getting a robust and
good functional test.  Unit tests have been added,
excersising the default_subnetpool option as well.

(modified, s/subnetpool_name_or_id/subnetpool/ ref code
review comments)

[{'created': '2018-03-05 11:56:37.000000000', 'message': "Allow grant_role to select users in a different domain

commit_message:
Allow grant_role to select users in a different domain

In our environment the admin user (belonging to the default domain)
was unable to grant rights to uses outside the default domain, as the
get_user method would not find the user without the domain_id
attribute set.  Adding the domain_id in the filter does not help, as
it's only filtering away results from the search.

Unfortunately I have not been able to reproduce this problem in
functional tests against a clean devstack - there the get_user method
has no problem finding users in different domains.

This is a redo of an earlier change that was reverted out by Sam
Yaple, as he wanted to deprecate the domain parameter in favor of
user_domain, group_domain and project_domain in the grant methods.
The parent changeset fixes that.

Unit tests have been mended to check that the domain_id is passed.

New unit tests have been added to excersise passing of the
user_domain_id, project_domain_id and group_domain_id parameters.

Change-Id: I5a93c6f53a176bd53560fa3b31b9ad9738e580dd
Task: 5853
Story: 2001302

With the recent changes to the upstream devstack job, switching from q-*
services to neutron-*, the Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES variable is no
longer being evaluated.

So instead we need to enable the neutron-qos service from the neutron
devstack plugin.

commit_message:
Allow client-side filters for nova floating ip list

In order to hide more differences in cloud behavior from the user, fall
back to client-side filtering in list_floating_ips if the cloud uses
nova floating ips and filters are given. This way we use server side
floating ips if they exist, and don't if they don't.

Change-Id: Ibeeafaaffb4e591d510f2f8ae18f95c2dc12e866

commit_message:
Fix user role grants

Before this patch it was impossible to grant a user or group a role for
a domain.

Change-Id: I43c97981d9e76f595efa2051b17a8425404179c4

This adds in a dynamically created/used project for testing purposed.
This is handled via an optional fixture that can be applied for a test or
test class. This type of dynamic project scoping fixture allows for given
tests to ensure there are no re-used/lingering resources that could
pollute the test results. This is exceptionally important for cases such
as floating-ips and network (SDN) tests due to some inherant racy-ness
within the tests (and similar tests with racy-conditions).

commit_message:
Add in a dynamic project scope test fixture

This adds in a dynamically created/used project for testing purposed.
This is handled via an optional fixture that can be applied for a test or
test class. This type of dynamic project scoping fixture allows for given
tests to ensure there are no re-used/lingering resources that could
pollute the test results. This is exceptionally important for cases such
as floating-ips and network (SDN) tests due to some inherant racy-ness
within the tests (and similar tests with racy-conditions).

Change-Id: I831d4e0741d815f80cde32c295b4171e02cdaf4b

If we're trying to delete a server and its floating ip and then we can't
find the floating ip - that's ok, we're trying to delete it.

Change-Id: I8a49013b56ef24c169ec7fbb939d65da69573b05
"}]
commit_message:
Don't error on 404 for floating ips while deleting

If we're trying to delete a server and its floating ip and then we can't
find the floating ip - that's ok, we're trying to delete it.

Change-Id: I8a49013b56ef24c169ec7fbb939d65da69573b05

commit_message:
Defer object interactions to openstacksdk

Override the object and image variables in the base Connection class so
that metadata keys for shade don't change.

openstacksdk doesn't do container autocreation, so we need to do that
ourselves.

The tests change because we do the container creation now first. The
same calls get made overall.

Change-Id: Ib2b7344d2fc6bf9063abc9ccd16681d79e8d8cf0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/586727

New features should be directed to openstasksdk. If this is a bugfix and you feel it has been abandoned in error, please restore the change and the shade team will work with you on it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 14:03:40.000000000', 'message': "Abort waiting for image on 404

When polling for an image status, we currently mask all errors found.
This is done to protect against transient API service errors impacting a
long-lived status poll.

A 404, however, is a bit different. If we've gotten the image id
already, that means the image exists on the cloud and we shouldn't get
404s. Bubble 404's up so that the waiting aborts.

This changes wait_for_image to use get_image_by_id rather than the
list/filter get_image. That should be ok for images, as unlikle servers
it's unlikely that someone is trying to create 1000 at a time.

Change-Id: Id6bea37ba716b0ad1f0a170cfd304585590ead61
"}]
commit_message:
Abort waiting for image on 404

When polling for an image status, we currently mask all errors found.
This is done to protect against transient API service errors impacting a
long-lived status poll.

A 404, however, is a bit different. If we've gotten the image id
already, that means the image exists on the cloud and we shouldn't get
404s. Bubble 404's up so that the waiting aborts.

This changes wait_for_image to use get_image_by_id rather than the
list/filter get_image. That should be ok for images, as unlikle servers
it's unlikely that someone is trying to create 1000 at a time.

Change-Id: Id6bea37ba716b0ad1f0a170cfd304585590ead61

- gate-dsvm-nodepool-src-zuulv3 http://logs.openstack.org/25/474425/2/check/gate-dsvm-nodepool-src-zuulv3/31ffeed/ : SUCCESS in 35m 11s'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-06-15 06:11:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I put a deliberate failure in the functional test to get the logs, and [1] shows pretty much what i'd expect for a simple progress notifier.  in the nodepool case, we could fairly easily extend this callback to log to a specific logger that saves upload logs per provider.  theoretically we could add a % done field to the image record too.

I'm not sure about the tasks-api side.  From my reading, perhaps we could instrument _upload_large_object in a similar fashion.  it's a bit trickier because it's doing thing in parallel.  

It would seem to involve instrumenting  wait_for_futures() to be able to make a callback when a future finishes.  Then, when each segment upload finishes (succesfully) it adds to a global total bytes uploaded variable.  This then calls back to the original program.  I can look at this if it is of interest. 

The simplest thing would be to punt on this but keep the general api for the image upload task.  Just for task-based uploads you'd only get two callbacks -- a 0% and an 100% done.  not much of a progress meter, but technically it works I guess.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/25/474425/2/check/gate-shade-functional/c94bfbe/logs/testr_results.html.gz"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

commit_message:
[WIP/RFC] add progress callback to image upload

This is just something to test the idea of a callback that gives some
progress updates as an image uploads.  we wrap the file-object that is
used in the PUT case ... dealing with tasks and volumes (maybe this
just doesn't apply for them...)

I am not 100% sure the read()'s are chunked in a way that makes this
useful

Change-Id: I9babe25740cae6baeae14b9457e661a707edc745

commit_message:
Fix _get_entity to accept a dict

The check that allows someone do to:

  delete_image(dict(id='some-id'))

without shade doing an image list and filter - only works if the user
does

  delete_image(munch.Munch(id='some-id'))

which is not pleasing. Update the check to also check for a dict instead
of just object attribute.

This updates two tests which

Change-Id: I103f60be4e57ea1a51f60feb668ef78f441ca3fa

commit_message:
Support server links attribute

Shade now supports the server links attribute returned by
GET /servers/$id. This is useful in cases like needing to configure dns
in some clouds via the instances self link attribute.

Note we always set the links value to empty list if there are no links
to make this more easily consumed across all the clouds.

Change-Id: I2872316caeeb3414a2c6db5df90641f877f73fa6

our test-requirements.txt file. We don't need the extra things in there
for the ansible tests, so skip them. This should give us at least one

We recently missed a missing requirement due to the requirement being in
our test-requirements.txt file. We don't need the extra things in there

commit_message:
Do not install test-requirements for ansible test

We recently missed a missing requirement due to the requirement being in
our test-requirements.txt file. We don't need the extra things in there
for the ansible tests, so skip them. This should give us at least one
place where we're testing exactly what we ship.

We also need to actually install ansible's dependencies.

Change-Id: Id37f4d53e086ba644b476b1b24ab6af4892113ca

recheck'}, {'account_id': 19115, 'date': '2018-04-23 14:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19115, 'date': '2018-04-24 08:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 19115, 'date': '2018-04-24 14:31:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-25 09:28:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I'd prefer to not do this and instead add parameters - that way we can provide client-side validation for the user.

Is there a reason it's not possible for us to just add the valid subnet parameters to the shade api? (I could be talked in to this - but we have a strong preference for explicit apis where possible)"}, {'account_id': 19115, 'date': '2018-04-25 09:58:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The use case here is that some third party neutron plugins actually extend the API, and this would allow us to still use shade to pass those parameters.
If we add specific parameters to shade's API, it becomes coupled with those plugins, and sometimes those plugins are vendor specific, like this:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/241260/"}, {'account_id': 19115, 'date': '2018-05-29 09:17:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Any update? Thanks'}, {'account_id': 19115, 'date': '2018-09-10 10:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Can someone have a look/reevaluate this PR?
Thanks'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Shade is in maintenance mode and is not accepting new features. New features should be directed to openstasksdk. If this is a bugfix and you feel it has been abandoned in error, please restore the change and the shade team will work with you on it.'}]

commit_message:
Adds kwargs support when creating a Neutron subnet

This change removes the parameter limitation exposed via shade
for Neutron subnet creation. This way, any key value passed via
`create_subnet` method is included in Neutron's API call.

Change-Id: I4a7004733c6a2b6ec689bb48dad9684e36da394d
Signed-off-by: Mário Santos <mario.rf.santos@gmail.com>

(1 comment)

Please add comments for the new domain_id param. Another thing to consider is to check identity version 3 using startswith rather than exact match in case the identity version becomes 3.1'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2016-10-21 18:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2016-10-22 14:28:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thanks for the contribution! The code looks good generally, but before we land this, I'd like to think a little deeper about the calling API. I'm not crazy about the addition of the domain_id parameter to all of the calls - but it may be the best choice.

Anyway - I'm going to look at this over the next day or two."}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2016-10-29 09:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The only other way I can think of doing this is working it into the filters dict.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2016-10-31 15:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we should do this with the existing pattern of being able to pass filters to list methods we use other places. Please see: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/391879/ ... which contains a good example of adding such filters.

Also - beware when passing filters from search_ to list_ - filters in search can be a dict of filters or a string containing a jmsepath expression, and the string should not be passed down to the list call.

grant_ and revoke_ look fine. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2016-11-07 12:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think I agree with Monty here. If we add each and every field/property in the signature of list/search methods, this could soon be unpleasant.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2016-11-09 14:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

API changes (this includes new parameters) requires a reno release note.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-06 14:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 03:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Shade is in maintenance mode and is not accepting new features. New features should be directed to openstasksdk. If this is a bugfix and you feel it has been abandoned in error, please restore the change and the shade team will work with you on it.'}]

commit_message:
Additional domain support for grant/revoke role

This code adds user, group, project and role domain support for grant
and revoke role. This is needed when cross domain role assignments are
used.

Depends-On: I59e9834d249ccda0beeb715a8d6271140fb144f4
Change-Id: I18adff14258b4ffe9ff23ad07fb0d0975f5e1954

commit_message:
Add a description field for port_create, port_update

'description' is a valid field for a port, accept it.

Change-Id: I9e273f390fdcaa06553268741407dbe704f3ce69

commit_message:
Apply caching to network resources

We list networks and subnets and routers a bunch, but they don't
change nearly as much. Add them to resources we cache. Also, keypairs.

Change-Id: Ia4a2b73ae538b9672b0fda8e3cdb94e3cb510444

commit_message:
Relegate "pool" to history

nova-network used a term "pool" to discuss where floating ips came from.
In neutron, they come from networks... but shade is old enough that the
word "pool" shows up in places it doesn't need to.

Change the word unconditionally in private methods.

For public methods with "pool" in the argument list, add a "network"
argument and make pool a backwards compat argument in the docs.

Change-Id: I55628f83c2dbf849a3f2b5dbc199d556d15e39f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 00:18:00.000000000', 'message': "Abort waiting for image on 404

When polling for an image status, we currently mask all errors found.
This is done to protect against transient API service errors impacting a
long-lived status poll.

A 404, however, is a bit different. If we've gotten the image id
already, that means the image exists on the cloud and we shouldn't get
404s. Bubble 404's up so that the waiting aborts.

This changes wait_for_image to use get_image_by_id rather than the
list/filter get_image. That should be ok for images, as unlikle servers
it's unlikely that someone is trying to create 1000 at a time.

Change-Id: Id6bea37ba716b0ad1f0a170cfd304585590ead61
"}, {'created': '2018-04-13 00:32:08.000000000', 'message': "Abort waiting for image on 404

When polling for an image status, we currently mask all errors found.
This is done to protect against transient API service errors impacting a
long-lived status poll.

A 404, however, is a bit different. If we've gotten the image id
already, that means the image exists on the cloud and we shouldn't get
404s. Bubble 404's up so that the waiting aborts.

This changes wait_for_image to use get_image_by_id rather than the
list/filter get_image. That should be ok for images, as unlikle servers
it's unlikely that someone is trying to create 1000 at a time.

Change-Id: Id6bea37ba716b0ad1f0a170cfd304585590ead61
"}]
commit_message:
Abort waiting for image on 404

When polling for an image status, we currently mask all errors found.
This is done to protect against transient API service errors impacting a
long-lived status poll.

A 404, however, is a bit different. If we've gotten the image id
already, that means the image exists on the cloud and we shouldn't get
404s. Bubble 404's up so that the waiting aborts.

This changes wait_for_image to use get_image_by_id rather than the
list/filter get_image. That should be ok for images, as unlikle servers
it's unlikely that someone is trying to create 1000 at a time.

Change-Id: Id6bea37ba716b0ad1f0a170cfd304585590ead61

commit_message:
Add functional test to show floating ip reuse

Also updated the auto_ips test to explicitly not re-use. In both tests,
ensure that the assert conditions work on both floating ip and
non-floating ip clouds, as both are viable devstack configs.

Change-Id: I74f2d38c48618236c8b4ecf874d7b72a43a53a35

messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-04-13 00:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:53:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nShade is in maintenance mode and is not accepting new features. New features should be directed to openstasksdk. If this is a bugfix and you feel it has been abandoned in error, please restore the change and the shade team will work with you on it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 00:32:08.000000000', 'message': "Don't throw errors when deleting nonexistant images

delete calls should not fail if the image is not there. They should be
successful, because the image is not, in fact, there, which is what the
user wants to happen.

Change-Id: Ic6edef2e5ce4f06cf534eb2df2f3d158748fe41f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't throw errors when deleting nonexistant images

delete calls should not fail if the image is not there. They should be
successful, because the image is not, in fact, there, which is what the
user wants to happen.

Change-Id: Ic6edef2e5ce4f06cf534eb2df2f3d158748fe41f

commit_message:
Add project_id parameter to list_volumes

People need to be able to list volumes in other projects.

Change-Id: Ib5286382099211411f4fa915d105b250d848cb9a

commit_message:
Revert "Revert per-resource dogpile.cache work"

This reverts commit 3f226d151181fd476ee719cf2bc523f7c1fd7420.

We reverted this originally because when we ran it in nodepool it seemed
that some things were caching incorrectly. Morgan has a follow up patch
that should help us with incorrect negative caching, but we'll need to
analyze what is missing in our testing to get this to be happy landing.

Note - this is not a pure revert - it has been updated to deal with the
underlying changes made since.

Change-Id: Ic9881c317ec40966ae0b82975fe4e8f0fd41045d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 15:04:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix IPv6 prefix delegation issue on agent restart

On l3-agent restart, prefix delegation subnets weren't always
inserted into the local router_info cache, leading to a missing
ip6tables rule.  Add it when the internal network is configured
if the prefix has already been assigned.

Change-Id: Ic045e2763ba2772bcaf037591821501e84e40878
Closes-bug: #1789403
(cherry picked from commit d19dcf1ef2f8e4b837e57dfef4ed1580c5d1e7b7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix IPv6 prefix delegation issue on agent restart

On l3-agent restart, prefix delegation subnets weren't always
inserted into the local router_info cache, leading to a missing
ip6tables rule.  Add it when the internal network is configured
if the prefix has already been assigned.

Change-Id: Ic045e2763ba2772bcaf037591821501e84e40878
Closes-bug: #1789403
(cherry picked from commit d19dcf1ef2f8e4b837e57dfef4ed1580c5d1e7b7)

commit_message:
Add configuration support for skipping tests

This patch add configuration support in Octavia Tempest Plugin,
in case a provider driver does not support Health Monitors.

Change-Id: I25eb52e9f64a08560c9ea2f664edd9826be6e379

[{'created': '2018-10-09 13:57:10.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I6a18fa58d85f0d75befedba4bac5cc3c116da73c
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I6a18fa58d85f0d75befedba4bac5cc3c116da73c

Remove Vagrant

The files for Vagrants are too outdated, this patch removes the
information about Vagrant in the documentation and the old files
used to set up a Vagrant environment.

The vars, tests and handlers folders are not properly packaged. This
change updates the setup.cfg to include these folders for distribution.

commit_message:
Update L7-proxy gate to allow new Octavia features

Specifically: UDP is now a valid protocol, and session_persistence has
some new fields.

Change-Id: I6f2ab6cad89714773655481a17a88348900261ad
(cherry picked from commit 28ede08e8cfa19d72d87c8e252f82bda761c0bce)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 19:08:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix NoneType error in _notify_volume_usage_detach

If the driver.block_stats() method returns None, like the
libvirt driver will if the guest is gone during an evacuate,
we'll get a NoneType error trying to unpack the return value
from the driver. Instead, simply return as if the driver
raised NotImplementedError.

Change-Id: I98a2785c07f7af02ad83650c72d9e1868290ece4
Closes-Bug: #1796981
"}, {'created': '2018-10-12 21:39:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix NoneType error in _notify_volume_usage_detach

If the driver.block_stats() method returns None, like the
libvirt driver will if the guest is gone during an evacuate,
we'll get a NoneType error trying to unpack the return value
from the driver. Instead, simply return as if the driver
raised NotImplementedError.

Since handling None is changing the contract on the virt
driver API, the docstring is updated to explain the acceptable
return values of the driver method.

Change-Id: I98a2785c07f7af02ad83650c72d9e1868290ece4
Closes-Bug: #1796981
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NoneType error in _notify_volume_usage_detach

If the driver.block_stats() method returns None, like the
libvirt driver will if the guest is gone during an evacuate,
we'll get a NoneType error trying to unpack the return value
from the driver. Instead, simply return as if the driver
raised NotImplementedError.

Since handling None is changing the contract on the virt
driver API, the docstring is updated to explain the acceptable
return values of the driver method.

Change-Id: I98a2785c07f7af02ad83650c72d9e1868290ece4
Closes-Bug: #1796981

subject: Run "nova-status upgrade check" during upgrade
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-14 23:39:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-14 23:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-15 06:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-15 06:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-15 22:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-15 22:47:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Eduardo, thanks for the pointers on this.

Is there an upgrade CI job that runs this upgrade script so we can verify this works? It's not obvious from the jobs that run on this change that any of them do the upgrade."}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-18 07:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, we currently dont have any real upgrade job, every deploy runs a upgrade task but is in the same version.

Based on the steps you pointed, could be done as:

1. deploy new code (we are in containers, so a deploy new code means using new code too)
2. sync db and run data migrations (done at https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/tasks/upgrade.yml#L5)
3. restart placement (handlers are executed by order of appearance in ansible, so placement is upgraded after ssh and libvirt containers, then every other service)
4. run nova-status upgrade check (could be added as handler after placement-api using a notify in the placement-api handler, so if it changes, upgrade check if executed in both deploy and upgrade)
5. restart nova services with new code (done if check does not fail, using any_errors_fatal to force fail every host)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-18 08:02:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Missed handlers link https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/handlers/main.yml#L53'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 14:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Looks like this is handled now:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558770/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-14 23:39:46.000000000', 'message': 'Run "nova-status upgrade check" during upgrade

This adds a task to run the 'nova-status upgrade check' command
during upgrade after restarting the services.

This is generally used for verifying an upgrade once the control
services have been upgraded, nova API DB has been migrated and
online data migrations have been run.

This is also an important tool for fast-forward upgrades to make
sure each release being forwarded through has been properly upgraded
before moving onto the next.

Change-Id: I5058208db8bebb8e7e78b216cc1916ae3851495f
'}]
commit_message:
Run "nova-status upgrade check" during upgrade

This adds a task to run the 'nova-status upgrade check' command
during upgrade after restarting the services.

This is generally used for verifying an upgrade once the control
services have been upgraded, nova API DB has been migrated and
online data migrations have been run.

This is also an important tool for fast-forward upgrades to make
sure each release being forwarded through has been properly upgraded
before moving onto the next.

Change-Id: I5058208db8bebb8e7e78b216cc1916ae3851495f

commit_message:
Ensure pool object contains the listener_id if passed

When creating a pool with an associated listener_id, sometimes the
listener_id is not set. Problem comes from [1] not setting the listeners
property on db_pool pool object even if it is passed.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/blob/master/octavia/api/v2/controllers/pool.py#L244-L245

Story: 2003833
Change-Id: I414a3c6d2e97d30ff12eda4ecf71ec032998df7d

[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:50:36.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3a20dc68bf1d4051724d148b0fa808ea3d0a1673
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3a20dc68bf1d4051724d148b0fa808ea3d0a1673
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-10-10 16:22:59.000000000', 'message': "Add ability for HTTP access to horizon

Horizon has, since OSA's inception, been deployed with HTTPS
access enabled, and has had no way to turn it off. Some use-cases
may want to access via HTTP instead, so this patch enables
the following:

1. Listen via HTTPS on a load balancer, but via HTTP on the

   This is the role's default behaviour which matches what it
   always has been.

3. Disable HTTPS entirely by setting ``haproxy_ssl: no`` (which
   will also disable https on haproxy. This setting is inherited
   by the new ``horizon_enable_ssl`` variable by default. This
   is a new option.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Add ability for HTTP access to horizon

Horizon has, since OSA's inception, been deployed with HTTPS
access enabled, and has had no way to turn it off. Some use-cases
may want to access via HTTP instead, so this patch enables
the following:

1. Listen via HTTPS on a load balancer, but via HTTP on the
   horizon host and have the load balancer forward the correct
   headers. It will do this by default in the integrated build
   due to the presence of the load balancer, so the current
   behaviour is retained.

2. Enable HTTPS on the horizon host without a load balancer.
   This is the role's default behaviour which matches what it
   always has been.

3. Disable HTTPS entirely by setting ``haproxy_ssl: no`` (which
   will also disable https on haproxy. This setting is inherited
   by the new ``horizon_enable_ssl`` variable by default. This
   is a new option.

Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Change-Id: I823f2f949258157e306dbf80570abe53373da0c3
Closes-Bug: 1794337

This sounds like subtracting common stuff relates to virtual bm from devstack and bifrost. It appears we still need a functional stack for Tenks to work, so my question is, how it simplifies building a development environment?'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-06 11:16:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> This sounds like subtracting common stuff relates to virtual bm
 > from devstack and bifrost. It appears we still need a functional
 > stack for Tenks to work, so my question is, how it simplifies
 > building a development environment?

I think there are two angles here.

One of the developer focused user stories is 'as an OpenStack developer', rather than ironic. For projects that don't use devstack this does help.

For ironic developers, I think the benefit is to aim to support the growing list of use cases in a single place (I know, standardising by adding a new standard and all that...). Also for developers of devstack/tenks, to do so in a saner environment than a pile of bash.

Does that answer the question?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-06 11:17:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> > This sounds like subtracting common stuff relates to virtual bm

 > devstack this does help.

 > growing list of use cases in a single place (I know, standardising
 > by adding a new standard and all that...). Also for developers of
 > devstack/tenks, to do so in a saner environment than a pile of
 > bash.
 > 
 > Does that answer the question?

We also have use cases as operators for testing bare metal cloud environments in CI."}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2018-09-08 02:56:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

> One of the developer focused user stories is 'as an OpenStack
 > developer', rather than ironic. For projects that don't use
 > devstack this does help.

My first impression on Tenks was managing VMs used by ironic, this seems has a wider scope, could be useful for developers (even beyond OpenStack I guess).

 > For ironic developers, I think the benefit is to aim to support the
 > growing list of use cases in a single place (I know, standardising
 > by adding a new standard and all that...). Also for developers of
 > devstack/tenks, to do so in a saner environment than a pile of
 > bash.

Sure, reusing common stuff is always a good thing to do."}, {'account_id': 20369, 'date': '2018-09-17 11:05:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2018-09-17 11:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

[{'created': '2018-07-02 14:48:10.000000000', 'message': '[WIP]: Add virtual Bare Metal Clusters spec

Testing Ironic has always been challenging.  Bare metal compute
resources are expensive and inflexible.  The typical solution to this
issue is to emulate bare metal compute resources using virtual machines
(VMs), allowing us to improve the utilisation of test infrastructure,
and test various scenarios using general purpose test infrastructure.
Support for creating virtual bare metal environments is available in
DevStack, and also in Bifrost.  These are used in OpenStack CI.  This
specification covers creation of a new tool for managing virtual bare
metal clusters.

commit_message:
Add virtual Bare Metal Clusters spec

Testing Ironic has always been challenging.  Bare metal compute
resources are expensive and inflexible.  The typical solution to this
issue is to emulate bare metal compute resources using virtual machines
(VMs), allowing us to improve the utilisation of test infrastructure,
and test various scenarios using general purpose test infrastructure.
Support for creating virtual bare metal environments is available in
DevStack, and also in Bifrost.  These are used in OpenStack CI.  This
specification covers creation of a new tool for managing virtual bare
metal clusters.

Story: #2003484
Task: #2471
Change-Id: I05e38f97c64144932bb5113873df7f8bb0a3cffb

subject: Add admin endpoint back
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11109, 'name': 'Roger Luethi', 'email': 'rl@patchworkscience.org', 'username': 'rluethi'}, {'_account_id': 11915, 'name': 'Jan Klare', 'email': 'jan@bisdn.de', 'username': 'jklare'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 14790, 'name': 'Samuel Cassiba', 'email': 'samuel@cassi.ba', 'username': 'scassiba'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2018-10-09 14:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2018-10-09 14:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14790, 'date': '2018-10-09 22:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-10-10 10:22:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The admin endpoint IIUC isn't needed anywhere. If you want consistency, why not clean up the other cookbooks?"}, {'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2018-10-12 03:53:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The change I am proposing fixes a regression that I have seen causing errors in tooling that assumes the variable to be set with a meaningful value. I assume that is not the only instance in our user base.

Cleaning up the other cookbooks would be a lot more work with a good chance of causing further regressions for our users. Before we embark on such a venture, we should consider the future of our endpoints; port based endpoints have been deprecated for some time as well, and that transition will inevitably cause all kinds of breakage. I don't want us to fall into the OpenStacky habit of breaking stuff every six months just because we think it looks better."}, {'account_id': 11915, 'date': '2018-10-17 08:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11109, 'date': '2018-10-17 13:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add admin endpoint back

The admin endpoint has been removed along with its dedicated port (35357).
This state is inconsistent with other cookbooks which all have an
admin endpoint despite not having a dedicated port for it.

This changeset brings back the attributes related to the admin endpoint.

backport: queens

Change-Id: Ica3ef83deb983929736da8a59175ad6b9e774940

commit_message:
Update Armada LMA manifest to include Elasticsearch S3 Repository

This enables the elasticsearch snapshot repository, which will
use the ceph radosgw s3 api to provision a s3 snapshot repository
for elasticsearch indices. It depends on the change that adds the
jobs required for leveraging the s3 api from openstack-helm-infra

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/559417
Change-Id: I064b4a16c2f9b86613c0a4180e77b48fa242ad95

subject: Add support for Octavia Driver: Cascade Delete

commit_message:
Add support for Octavia Driver: Cascade Delete

This patch adds the support for updating the DB during
Cascade deletion for LBs. Currently, the flows are deleted but
the status of the entities connected with the LBs are not cleared,
thus causing an uneven status in the DB.

Change-Id: I31da7134d51665bbfe316b8a05cc34216420a4d0
Closes-Bug: #1793759

commit_message:
Distro-install tests for Ubuntu and Centos are voting now.

This patch makes available to completely move to zuul templates,
by adding openstack-ansible-role-distro_install-jobs into list.

Added small fixes to make them working.
Centos has gnocchi_resources.yaml packed with ceilometer-common package,
so test was failing on db_setup task.

Also ceilometer user was not created, as it checks for existance of
ceilometer_central_container group, which was not defined in inventory.

Change-Id: I7fd7a949724f4fa52fa48534a6ef6c8a8efdc290

commit_message:
Update tox.ini

Removed py34, py27 and pypy from the tox.ini envlist since
there are no unit tests,  and tox reports it skipped all tests.

commit_message:
add service account for glance-simplestreams-sync

The glance-simplestreams-sync cron job was being run by the root user.
Best practice suggests that the root user should not be used unless
necessary, so a gss service account is created with sudo privileges in
order to comply with this concern.

This commit cannot be said to close the existing bug, as smoke tests do
 not currently pass (although just running tox for unit tests passes),
so this will need to be addressed in a subsequent commit.

Change-Id: I8019e6771488b764b78f1fed8b3e9b6b65fc02fa
Related-Bug: 1771977

This needs further testing.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:48:38.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Workflow-1 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:48:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from osh_bindep to overridable_chainable_bindep-OSH'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from overridable_chainable_bindep-OSH to overridable_chainable_bindep'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from overridable_chainable_bindep to overridable_chainable_bindeps'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-11 07:55:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7822, 'date': '2018-10-12 16:05:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Right now, being in the middle of a process to remove expernal-consumer specific code that is deeply intertwined in a project tree, I'm very hesitant to take on the responsibility of maintaining the correctness of those files. Three downsides come to mind

* There's no guarantee that any project will live longer than Loci. If that happens, who becomes responsible for removing that code. What's the condition or trigger for it?
* What's the criteria for allowing an external project to store their configuration in a general repository? How do you guarantee fairness?
* If there's a critical bug in project-specific files that impacts an external project, how do we get quick review in on a project they don't own?

All of these problems are solved by this patch, allowing external pydep and bindep
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/602180/"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-17 12:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

IMO this should go to the extra bindep argument, and this should be done outside loci. If someone wants to bring this in, (s)he can.'}]

commit_message:
Add OSH bindep file

This adds an OpenStack-Helm bindep file in the LOCI tree.

The current use case is:
- allow utils to include iproute2 package so it can be used
  perform readinessProbe. No extra profile for OSH need to be added
  in LOCI if we can provide an OSH bindep file as build argument.
- remove the need to carry in openstack-helm a list of packages
  to add in image building [1][2][3]. Luckily enough for me,
  those packages have the same name for openSUSE, CentOS, and Ubuntu.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/blob/64cb013dff3bc6181eb01f2bcb737a83b296b96b/tools/images/openstack/pike/loci.sh#L47
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/blob/64cb013dff3bc6181eb01f2bcb737a83b296b96b/tools/images/openstack/pike/loci.sh#L103
[3]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm/blob/64cb013dff3bc6181eb01f2bcb737a83b296b96b/tools/images/openstack/pike/loci.sh#L170

Change-Id: I8746229bb86d08c17e51bccb68564a9dc2ad8260

subject: Increment versioning with pbr instruction
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:25.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Iafbf190511422cf9a69327e0d347ca0cd3c39be3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Iafbf190511422cf9a69327e0d347ca0cd3c39be3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Configure sudoers for zun containers
messages: [{'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-10-15 08:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-10-15 09:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-10-15 09:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:10:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-10-16 07:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-10-17 09:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 08:53:17.000000000', 'message': "Configure sudoers for zun containers

Zun processes were run as user 'root' in before. This is undesirable
for several reasons (i.e. security, privsep). This patch make the
Zun processes run as 'zun' user, which aligns with the practice of
other containers.

commit_message:
Configure sudoers for zun containers

Zun processes were run as user 'root' in before. This is undesirable
for several reasons (i.e. security, privsep). This patch make the
Zun processes run as 'zun' user, which aligns with the practice of
other containers.

Leave zun-api default user to root in order to run under apache2.

Change-Id: I0d3111f0ca6301d6f22410fe5fd5a2dbf586e691
Closes-Bug: #1787760
(cherry picked from commit 0b2682e489fe67a6f43596ea61291d92107c3569)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 18:52:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update sphinx logging to not use app object

Logging via the application object was deprecated in sphinx 1.6 and is
now removed in the master branch that will become 2.0. This updates our
sphinx extension to use the recommended sphinx.util.logging instead.

Closes-bug: #1798174

Change-Id: Ie66579146d68680905c3eac3d256369309130cf4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update sphinx logging to not use app object

Logging via the application object was deprecated in sphinx 1.6 and is
now removed in the master branch that will become 2.0. This updates our
sphinx extension to use the recommended sphinx.util.logging instead.

Closes-bug: #1798174

Change-Id: Ie66579146d68680905c3eac3d256369309130cf4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Ignore 'use_tpool' option
messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-09 11:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2018-03-09 17:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-03-09 19:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9373, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 0602eb60a79a1affda9ccf46423e20333baeaf3c'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 11:05:14.000000000', 'message': "Ignore 'use_tpool' option

The sheer act of registering the 'use_tpool' option seems to be enough
to cause the following warning:

   NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not
   supported

Add it to the list of ignored opts, thus silencing this warning.

Change-Id: I4a5f8958c3e0fc68fa3a4ae979f284c4fbd9b82b
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore 'use_tpool' option

The sheer act of registering the 'use_tpool' option seems to be enough
to cause the following warning:

   NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not
   supported

Add it to the list of ignored opts, thus silencing this warning.

Change-Id: I4a5f8958c3e0fc68fa3a4ae979f284c4fbd9b82b

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I0be72374f6e1b55286e66481924cceca5a2331cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-11 16:44:53.000000000', 'message': "Use advanced image only when it's necessary

In some scenario tests there is need to use advanced image,
like Ubuntu or Centos, because Cirros doesn't provide required
features.
It is like that in some tests from modules:

    neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_mtu
    neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_trunk

But such advanced image needs much more time to boot and to
have SSH to vm available.

There is no need to use such advanced image in all tests.

This patch makes some changes in tempest plugin config options:

* image_is_advanced - option is removed,
* advanced_image_ref - new option added - it's uuid for advanced image,
* advanced_flavor_ref - new option added - id of flavor to use with
  advanced image
* advanced_image_ssh_user - new option added - name of user to use
  to ssh to vm booted from advanced image,

This patch also modify neutron_tempest_plugin devstack plugin that
it now can find advanced image id in installed Glance service and
configure those new config options in Tempest's config file.

This patch also modifies scenario jobs definitions that this
new advanced_image can be configured and used when it's nesessary.

Finally this patch also changes tests mentioned above that now
this advanced image is used in those tests.
All other scenario tests should works with default, Cirros image.

Change-Id: If1b83fbaf33cc01473badeb5cabc8e8670d51d9e

But such advanced image needs much more time to boot and to
have SSH to vm available.

There is no need to use such advanced image in all tests.

This patch makes some changes in tempest plugin config options:

* image_is_advanced - option is removed,
* advanced_image_ref - new option added - it's uuid for advanced image,
* advanced_flavor_ref - new option added - id of flavor to use with
  advanced image
* advanced_image_ssh_user - new option added - name of user to use
  to ssh to vm booted from advanced image,

This patch also modify neutron_tempest_plugin devstack plugin that
it now can find advanced image id in installed Glance service and
configure those new config options in Tempest's config file.

This patch also modifies scenario jobs definitions that this
new advanced_image can be configured and used when it's nesessary.

Finally this patch also changes tests mentioned above that now
this advanced image is used in those tests.
All other scenario tests should works with default, Cirros image.

Change-Id: If1b83fbaf33cc01473badeb5cabc8e8670d51d9e

commit_message:
Use advanced image only when it's necessary

In some scenario tests there is need to use advanced image,
like Ubuntu or Centos, because Cirros doesn't provide required
features.
It is like that in some tests from modules:

    neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_mtu
    neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_trunk

But such advanced image needs much more time to boot and to
have SSH to vm available.

There is no need to use such advanced image in all tests.

This patch makes some changes in tempest plugin config options:

* image_is_advanced - option is removed,
* advanced_image_ref - new option added - it's uuid for advanced image,
* advanced_flavor_ref - new option added - id of flavor to use with
  advanced image
* advanced_image_ssh_user - new option added - name of user to use
  to ssh to vm booted from advanced image,

This patch also modify neutron_tempest_plugin devstack plugin that
it now can find advanced image id in installed Glance service and
configure those new config options in Tempest's config file.

This patch also modifies scenario jobs definitions that this
new advanced_image can be configured and used when it's nesessary.

Finally this patch also changes tests mentioned above that now
this advanced image is used in those tests.
All other scenario tests should works with default, Cirros image.

Change-Id: If1b83fbaf33cc01473badeb5cabc8e8670d51d9e

change tox envlist from 3.5 to 3

base python version is 3, not 3.5 and
python 3.5 is not installed in some current
distros so running 'tox' locally fails.

commit_message:
Fix ceph-nfs duplicate property

In change I78c16c9fb28211a7a8ec2187ae76b9a072b76ea2 we eliminated
startup races with ceph nfs, but we need to make sure we do
not create duplicate properies or puppet will fail.

While we're at it we also point the bootstrapnode at
ceph_nfs_short_bootstrap_node_name instead of which is more correct.
It is functionally the same if ceph-nfs and manila-share run on the
same nodes, which is likely the case in most cases, but best
make it correct while we're at it.

Closes-Bug: #1798020

Change-Id: I5a41f95b2d91a25fe617afb9ada0b5201d2b7ef7
(cherry picked from commit 7e3219ff2b2ec3fdd43f0dd26dc487b78ccbf3eb)

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I5166432f683f9b8555ee5dad8ac38f7ecdd2d364

set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6e18dd70a74694ba2e7aad535f487498a26d05bb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Enabled feature negotation for qos rules

This patch enables feature negotiations for qos rules. Now
configuration of rules are being fetched from the get_config
api of the odl_feature

Change-Id: Iacba50efe8fc4eee3ebac14423852aa87f2d72e8
Closes-bug: #1686625
(cherry picked from commit 86175e8f557f1f7930e097cab8345a40b8bce6f8)

commit_message:
ODL feature fetch: parse configs

ODL supports a configuration string for each feature.
This string is now extracted from the json and made
available in the odl_features API.

Co-Authored-By: Michel Peterson <michel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I274f9ac337be5acd1f56d173fcd7584c82dd3b24

commit_message:
ODL DHCP Port to be created only for Ipv4 subnets.

OpenDaylight DHCP service only supports ARP Responder
feature for IPv4 subnets today. This fix will avoid
creation of a DHCP port for IPv6 subnets and ensure
no processing of these ports happens from ODL for
DHCP/IPv6 services.

OpenDaylight IPv6 service internally creates improper
bindings on these ports leading to inconsistencies in the
OpenDaylight environment.

Cherry-picked from commit Id4a493aa2dfbd21b6d3cff666eaf44f58a3aec1f

Closes-Bug: 1746715

Change-Id: Id4a493aa2dfbd21b6d3cff666eaf44f58a3aec1f

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: Id54b5264ea42c9f08c95a9d64fa7b4e334718baa

commit_message:
Fix l2gateway driver

ODL expects 'gateway_id' attribute for l2_gateway_connection but
neutron provides 'l2_gateway_id' therefore full sync operation could
not be performed for L2GW resources. This patch filter the results
as per ODL expectation.

Change-Id: I8daa7364103804715795b40fe5a18bd2dd0ffa53
closes-bug: #1715133

[{'created': '2017-12-19 17:53:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix unit tests py27, py35

This patch addresses two issues (1) and (2).

(1). Add subnet_id and floating_ip_address

Neutron merged a change [x]. to add subnet_id and
floating_ip_address to port's fixed_ips, which expects
both the keys in floating_ip_data and broke the unit
tests. This patch add floating_ip_address and subnet_id
to mock fip data used for tests.

(2). Change the type of sync_timeout
the other issue I observed was a math error due to use
of unrounded intervals for sync timeout. This patch changes
the type of sync_timeout to FloatOpt.

TODO: There are pep8 issues as well, like return semantics not
correct, third party modules import order and raising format tuple
which will be addressed separately.

[x]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/

(cherry picked from commit 3e71d91ad3a8f35aa2d0d0237bae26180131759f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unit tests py27, py35

This patch addresses two issues (1) and (2).

(1). Add subnet_id and floating_ip_address

Neutron merged a change [x]. to add subnet_id and
floating_ip_address to port's fixed_ips, which expects
both the keys in floating_ip_data and broke the unit
tests. This patch add floating_ip_address and subnet_id
to mock fip data used for tests.

(2). Change the type of sync_timeout
the other issue I observed was a math error due to use
of unrounded intervals for sync timeout. This patch changes
the type of sync_timeout to FloatOpt.

TODO: There are pep8 issues as well, like return semantics not
correct, third party modules import order and raising format tuple
which will be addressed separately.

[x]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521707/

Change-Id: I3b498400f7b6455077e13e62eee3df4502f78dcb
(cherry picked from commit 3e71d91ad3a8f35aa2d0d0237bae26180131759f)

commit_message:
Add provision to specify java arguments to ODL

Java options like heap size configuration needs
tweaking for large scale deployments. Allow
customizing those values from TripleO.

puppet-opendaylight will configure these values
in ODL. Corresponding puppet-opendaylight patch is
https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/68491

Change-Id: I99e08314dedfcc71a776423ac3c6c282237cc0c2
Closes-Bug: #1794073

> bgpvpn initial Ocata release (6.0.0) doesn't include the patch that
 > you need for the change. I am afraid we will need to live without
 > this backport for Ocata.

Hi Ihar,

Actually, the corresponding change in bgpvpn code was merged on Apr 2: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449533/. Hence I backported the changes.

I agree 6.0.0 does not contain the fix. 

Thanks,
Deepthi"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2017-05-18 19:08:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

For what I understand, networking-odl doesn't specify a minimal version for bgpvpn right now at all. So how do we notify consumers about the new requirement?"}, {'account_id': 9361, 'date': '2017-09-21 13:01:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Thomas / Isaku,

We want to get version parity done between networking-bgpvpn and networking-odl. 

we want to push this patch and tag this against next version of networking-bgpvpn (i.e, 6.0.1 to be pulled) which will include https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449533/.

So we kindly request your help if we can pull an SR for networking-bgpvpn and label it with 6.0.1.

After that we can merge this patch and then get a new tag for networking-odl and use that matrix for consumers.

Vivek'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2017-09-21 15:48:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

regarding to networking-odl, I'm fine to release 11.0.N after bgpvpn stable/pike release."}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-09-21 18:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

So, do you want to add release note or smth to the branch that would at least notify users about the change in the minimal requirement?'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2017-09-21 20:10:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> We want to get version parity done between networking-bgpvpn and
 > networking-odl.
 > 
 > we want to push this patch and tag this against next version of
 > networking-bgpvpn (i.e, 6.0.1 to be pulled) which will include
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/449533/.
 > 
 > So we kindly request your help if we can pull an SR for
 > networking-bgpvpn and label it with 6.0.1.

I've got no objection on tagging a 6.0.1 on stable/ocata.

You can actually ask for a release yourself by pushing a change to openstack/releases in [1] to add an entry for 6.0.1 for commit id 28ee4b7ead53492abc3f70dbd8cf294c6fc70444 (please add me as a reviewer).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/8429f8d90abd4b33f9753d6580fa465b89303709/deliverables/_independent/networking-bgpvpn.yaml"}, {'account_id': 9361, 'date': '2017-09-22 07:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9361, 'date': '2017-09-22 07:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-22 08:45:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1
