[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:48:09.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I484955ae9624875a9067fed087033a98c351fec0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I484955ae9624875a9067fed087033a98c351fec0
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Import periodic-tempest-dsvm-oslo-latest-full-master job

This job can use tempest-full now. It tests that current oslo
development versions work with OpenStack server projects.

The list of oslo jobs tested is the same as in the current job
periodic-tempest-dsvm-oslo-latest-full-master.

In the past it was triggered periodicially as part of devstack job,
let's move it to tempest repo from project-config since tempest-full is
defined in tempest repository and tempest is branchless, so we can
easily run this here on master which is more difficult with devstack
which is branched.

Change-Id: I8e29db5879e854afe8a46c8914d66ea64a2989ea

commit_message:
Remove redundant target in README

An 'example' anchor was being explicitly added that was
redundant with the 'Example' title it preceeded. This
causes failures with `python setup.py check -s -r` which
was added to release validation to prevent pypi package
upload failures.

Since the README is imported into the built docs, and the
docs link to the examples using this hidden anchor, this
renames it to avoid a conflict.

Change-Id: I6947e0ae420402cc9866e3c374626392b1d5194c

commit_message:
Replace skopeo inspect with python

This replaces the skopeo inspect calls with python equivalent. It is
faster than the skopeo inspect for two reasons:
- the auth token is shared for all requests
- the tags list request is made concurrently

This should also help with running the dry-run prepare in the mistral
podman container since /run is not involved at all in this
implementation.

Change-Id: Ia898d0acfdeac1699e7e08e2935a2a4eaf578531
Closes-Bug: #1797114

commit_message:
Switch bare metal NIC actions in OpenStackCloud to baremetal Proxy calls

This change allows bare metal NIC actions to use the microversion
negotiation process instead of the hardcoded version 1.6.

Change-Id: I0d31251fc110b9db744509ce6f254745a13acebf

commit_message:
Repair ansible when calls with jinja2

- adopts official syntax for 'when:' commands
- assures we use current linter which spots when errors
- reverts temporary linter rule disablement
- use parsable output (pep8 like) for ansible-lint

Change-Id: I6eb5719841c2f264e1efed4bf38726f71c840e36
Closes-Bug: #1797838

subject: WIP: More starlingxdocs theme support
messages:
[{'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-10-08 21:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-09 04:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-09 04:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-10-09 18:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Andreas, this is WIP, I was restoring the bits Scott pushed over my last review accidently for him to continue, I should have had WIP in the commit message.

Much of the header and footer content needs to be reviewed with the foundation marketing folk, some of it I imagine will survive, much of course will not...'}, {'account_id': 29039, 'date': '2018-10-11 21:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-10-11 22:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-12 06:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-10-12 16:19:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Andreas, this is following the course outlined in discussion with members of the docs team and Doug in Denver.  Please expand on what is wropng and what you think might be the correct course of action.

We are publishing docs for a release in less than two weeks.  I wish the dissent on this approach had come earlier.  Stephen has said elsewhere he doesn't like it either.  Our alternative is to fork it and we've seen how that is received in the rest of the OpenStack community.  I've spent the last 9 months trying to figure out how to get rid of forks, I really do not want to create another one.

I see how to override the setting in a single repo (governance, etc), we have approx 30+ sphinx build trees to apply this to, I am not about to handle this that way..."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-10-12 16:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

OK, it was pointed out to me that I mis-read Andreas' comment, I saw it as a top-level comment and I believe he meant it as pertaining to the release note.  Please accept my  apologies for that last comment..."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-12 17:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Dean, apology accepted. Yes, it was meant as a comment for that single file. I just wanted you to help moving forward and give early feedback on an obvious error...'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-10-12 22:27:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(11 comments)

Scott, I think we don't need to include the header and footer until we talk to foundation staff about which things they thing should stick around.  We simply don't need license_cc.html, it's the same as OpenStack and the link points into the foundation legal site which is the same for everyone."}, {'account_id': 29039, 'date': '2018-10-15 19:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
WIP: More starlingxdocs theme support

Changes to theme files in starlingx theme so linked items do not try
and go off to the openstack locations.

Change-Id: I5b33b5559cc761cb726f23470af79be04f5e31fa
Signed-off-by: Scott Rifenbark <srifenbark@gmail.com>

(9 comments)

First, I'd like to say that I appreciate this patch quite a bit. I know first-hand just how aggravating the unit tests around the compute manager's handling of claims can be. So, thank you Nikola for addressing this long-standing problem in Nova.

That said, I have a few concerns about the code as-is. Chief among those concerns is the fact that this patch references the hypervisor_nodename attribute of the HostState returned from the scheduler. This attribute is only ever used by the Ironic virt driver and the Ironic custom resource tracker in the single nova-compute daemon that has to manage all Ironic baremetal nodes. We want to eventually (soon!) get rid of the entire hypervisor_hostname field from the compute_nodes table. And since live migration can never occur between two bare metal hosts, I see no reason to introduce the nodename to the live migration interfaces here.

Secondly, I was wondering why you don't just pass the Migration object directly down into the _do_check_live_migrate_destination() internal method on the compute manager? You have a TODO in there to do this, but since the only place that calls _do_check_live_migrate_destination() is right above it and you changed that call location in this patch, I'm wondering why you created a new Migration object inside _do_check_live_migrate_destination(). See inline comments for details.

Finally, I think the whole _SENTINEL thing is kind of fluffy and could be more straightforward by just checking to see if the migration is in a terminal state directly. Also see inline...

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2016-03-21 12:20:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(6 comments)

This doesn't make the live migration code any more readable -- in fact an argument can be made that this makes things less readable. However, it does "fix" the resource tracker to account for live migrations in its audit and claim process, so I'm OK with it.

Would have been great to see a smaller patch, but actually I'm not sure a smaller patch would be possible given what I know about the awfulness of test_compute_mgr.py and its kin.

(4 comments)

I tested the macvtap live migration and it is not working.
we will need a follow up patch.
The problem is basically that in the pre_live_migration will vif.plug
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/bc34c0a8b209de772588d9a6770e33b026d4c8ed/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py#L6684-L6687  
but the instance and the neutron port has the old pci device in it.
so we will get exception in here https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/bc34c0a8b209de772588d9a6770e33b026d4c8ed/nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py#L631-L636

by the newer libvirt version has problem with macvtap and setting the correct mac on the macvtap net device see this commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/364121/ and this issue Bugzilla issue https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1372944.'}, {'account_id': 12299, 'date': '2016-12-12 21:27:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 46:

Lee: I'm not sure if it will actually make sense to write the XML on the destination, it may not have enough information to do so properly.  Also, we'll still need some of the work being done in this patch.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-12 07:56:39.000000000', 'message': "live-mig: Add claims and proper resource tracking

This patch adds the claims mechanism to the live migration control flow.
There are several points that are worht noting about this (somewhat
beefy) patch.

 * Adds migration object, and other scheduler related data to the
   check_can_live_migrate_destination which is where the claim happens.
   Since the claim logic updates the migration record with the target
   host, we remove this update from the conductor.
 * We do not drop the claim at any point - this could be improved in a
   future patch, but was left out to keep this patch easier to review.
 * Makes sure that we apply the migration context after a successful
   live migration, and that we drop it upon failure.
 * Makes sure that the migration record status is updated in failure
   and success scenarios, as this is necessary for correct resource
   tracking
 * Missing is (in libvirt's case) is applying the migration context do
   the xml we pass to the migrateToURI2 API call. This makes this no
   more broken than it was before.

Change-Id: Ie80983bb8ce4c8ad1a5761f29140da8a970a29d3
Partial-bug: 1417667
"}, {'created': '2015-11-12 08:13:35.000000000', 'message': "live-mig: Add claims and proper resource tracking

This patch adds the claims mechanism to the live migration control flow.
There are several points that are worht noting about this (somewhat
beefy) patch.

 * Adds migration object, and other scheduler related data to the
   check_can_live_migrate_destination which is where the claim happens.
   Since the claim logic updates the migration record with the target
   host, we remove this update from the conductor.
 * We do not drop the claim at any point - this could be improved in a
   future patch, but was left out to keep this patch easier to review.
 * Makes sure that we apply the migration context after a successful
   live migration, and that we drop it upon failure.
 * Makes sure that the migration record status is updated in failure
   and success scenarios, as this is necessary for correct resource
   tracking
 * Missing is (in libvirt's case) is applying the migration context do
   the xml we pass to the migrateToURI2 API call. This makes this no
   more broken than it was before.

 * We can now track live migration records in the resource tracker so we
   remove the check that would skip them when updating resources.

   the xml we pass to the migrateToURI2 API call. This makes this no
   more broken than it was before.

"}, {'created': '2016-07-05 14:27:25.000000000', 'message': "live-mig: Add claims and proper resource tracking

This patch adds the claims mechanism to the live migration control flow.
There are several points that are worth noting about this (somewhat
beefy) patch.

 * Adds migration object, and other scheduler related data to the
   check_can_live_migrate_destination which is where the claim happens.
   Since the claim logic updates the migration record with the target
   host, we remove this update from the conductor.

   The claim happens on the first call to the destination node. It is
   worth noting that in case the destination was specified when live
   migration API was called, no claims will happen.
 * We do not drop the claim at any point - this could be improved in a
   future patch, but was left out to keep this patch easier to review.
 * Makes sure that we apply the migration context after a successful
   live migration, and that we drop it upon failure.
 * Makes sure that the migration record status is updated in failure
   and success scenarios, as this is necessary for correct resource
   tracking
 * We can now track live migration records in the resource tracker so we
   remove the check that would skip them when updating resources.
 * Currently missing (in libvirt's case) is applying the migration
   context to the xml we pass to the migrateToURI2 API call.
   This makes this no more broken than it was before, and is addressed
   in a follow-up patch

Partial-bug: 1417667
Partial-bug: 1289064

Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ie80983bb8ce4c8ad1a5761f29140da8a970a29d3

"}, {'created': '2016-11-02 14:11:03.000000000', 'message': "live-mig: Add claims and proper resource tracking

This patch adds the claims mechanism to the live migration control flow.
There are several points that are worth noting about this (somewhat
beefy) patch.

 * Adds migration object, and other scheduler related data to the
   check_can_live_migrate_destination which is where the claim happens.
   Since the claim logic updates the migration record with the target
   host, we remove this update from the conductor.

   The claim happens on the first call to the destination node. It is
   worth noting that in case the destination was specified when live
   migration API was called, no claims will happen.
 * We do not drop the claim at any point - this could be improved in a
   future patch, but was left out to keep this patch easier to review.
 * Makes sure that we apply the migration context after a successful
   live migration, and that we drop it upon failure.
 * Makes sure that the migration record status is updated in failure
   and success scenarios, as this is necessary for correct resource
   tracking
 * We can now track live migration records in the resource tracker so we
   remove the check that would skip them when updating resources.
 * Currently missing (in libvirt's case) is applying the migration
   context to the xml we pass to the migrateToURI2 API call.
   This makes this no more broken than it was before, and is addressed
   in a follow-up patch

Change-Id: Ie80983bb8ce4c8ad1a5761f29140da8a970a29d3
Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Partial-bug: 1417667
Partial-bug: 1289064

"}, {'created': '2017-01-23 08:12:49.000000000', 'message': "live-mig: Add claims and proper resource tracking

This patch adds the claims mechanism to the live migration control flow.
There are several points that are worth noting about this (somewhat
beefy) patch.

 * Adds migration object, and other scheduler related data to the
   check_can_live_migrate_destination which is where the claim happens.
   Since the claim logic updates the migration record with the target
   host, we remove this update from the conductor.

   The claim happens on the first call to the destination node. It is
   worth noting that in case the destination was specified when live
   migration API was called, no claims will happen.
 * We do not drop the claim at any point - this could be improved in a
   future patch, but was left out to keep this patch easier to review.
 * Makes sure that we apply the migration context after a successful
   live migration, and that we drop it upon failure.
 * Makes sure that the migration record status is updated in failure
   and success scenarios, as this is necessary for correct resource
   tracking
 * We can now track live migration records in the resource tracker so we
   remove the check that would skip them when updating resources.
 * Currently missing (in libvirt's case) is applying the migration
   context to the xml we pass to the migrateToURI2 API call.
   This makes this no more broken than it was before, and is addressed
   in a follow-up patch

Change-Id: Ie80983bb8ce4c8ad1a5761f29140da8a970a29d3
Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Partial-bug: 1417667
Partial-bug: 1289064

commit_message:
live-mig: Add claims and proper resource tracking

This patch adds the claims mechanism to the live migration control flow.
There are several points that are worth noting about this (somewhat
beefy) patch.

 * Adds migration object, and other scheduler related data to the
   check_can_live_migrate_destination which is where the claim happens.
   Since the claim logic updates the migration record with the target
   host, we remove this update from the conductor.

   The claim happens on the first call to the destination node. It is
   worth noting that in case the destination was specified when live
   migration API was called, no claims will happen.

 * We do not drop the claim at any point - this could be improved in a
   future patch, but was left out to keep this patch easier to review.

 * Makes sure that we apply the migration context after a successful
   live migration, and that we drop it upon failure.

 * Makes sure that the migration record status is updated in failure
   and success scenarios, as this is necessary for correct resource
   tracking

 * We can now track live migration records in the resource tracker so we
   remove the check that would skip them when updating resources.

 * Currently missing (in libvirt's case) is applying the migration
   context to the xml we pass to the migrateToURI2 API call.
   This makes this no more broken than it was before, and is addressed
   in a follow-up patch

Change-Id: Ie80983bb8ce4c8ad1a5761f29140da8a970a29d3
Co-Authored-By: Sylvain Bauza <sbauza@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sahid Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pawel Koniszewski <pawel.koniszewski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Partial-bug: 1417667
Partial-bug: 1289064

[{'created': '2018-10-09 13:31:17.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args

Change-Id: I050c75a2957f42448994716f0da924a45d5f3083
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I050c75a2957f42448994716f0da924a45d5f3083

subject: Change configuration section names
messages:
[{'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-09-03 10:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-02 08:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi Martin, thank you for this patch! It has been an open issue for a long time!

This implementation feels a bit hacky: we should not parse the olso config file by ourselves. Could you please use oslo config's "deprecated_group" option instead ?

About options which are currently registered by keystone: we can load them, create our own options based on those and register them ourselves, see example for gnocchi collector:

"""
DEPRECATED_GNOCCHI_COLLECTOR_OPTS = 'gnocchi_collector'
GNOCCHI_COLLECTOR_OPTS = 'collector_gnocchi'

keystone_opts = ks_loading.get_auth_common_conf_options() + \
    ks_loading.get_session_conf_options()

gnocchi_collector_opts = [cfg.Opt(
    name=o.name,
    type=o.type,
    deprecated_group=DEPRECATED_GNOCCHI_COLLECTOR_OPTS) for o in keystone_opts]
"""

Other remarks:

- There is an open story about this on storyboard: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2001053. I assigned you to it. Please update your commit message in order to add "Story" and "Task".

- Please add a deprecation releasenote

- Last point: "as been updated" -> "has been updated" in the commit message'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:14:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Luka! Thanks for the review! I was not aware of the deprecated_group option, this deprecation is easier to implement with it! Thanks :D
I also joined this old story to my commit :)'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-11 09:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Hi Martin, I think you forgot to modify some options in the gnocchi collector (see in-file comments).

Other remarks:

* Please also update the fetchers (groups are still called keystone_fetcher and source_fetcher). 

* Please update the "{backend_type}_{backend_name}" part of the documentation and remove the note.

* Seems like Storyboard has not taken the "Task" mention in the commit message into account. Could you try to put only one space between the colon and the task id ?'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:39:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Luka! Thanks to our discuss earlier I understood what I was confusing about. I correctly made the changes related to the first comment and also for the fetchers. I removed the undesired space in the commit message but it seems that gerrit did not took the change for the display.

I also made bit of renaming to be more consistent between files, nothing critical :)'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-12 07:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-12 08:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-12 15:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-15 07:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Looks almost ready to me, but the keystone fetcher still needs some work'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-15 08:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26767, 'date': '2018-10-15 08:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-15 09:13:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

LGTM, thanks! I'll try to test this today and vote again afterwards"}, {'account_id': 23060, 'date': '2018-10-15 14:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Change configuration section names

In order to respect the convention [backendtype_backendname]
for all collectors and storage backends in Cloudkitty configuration
some sections names has changed.

  * For the Gnocchi collector, [collector_gnocchi] has been added
    in addition to [gnocchi_collector].
    This last one will be removed in the future.

  * For the hybrid storage, [storage_hybrid] has been added
    in addition to [hybrid_storage].
    This last one will be removed in the future.

  * For the keystone fetcher, [fetcher_keystone] has been added
    in addition to [keystone_fetcher].
    This last one will be removed in the future.

  * For the hybrid storage, [fetcher_source] has been added
    in addition to [source_fetcher].
    This last one will be removed in the future.

  * Fix Prometheus section name.

Change-Id: I3435a151de4b384f2f2540225504abe6c99b928e
Story: 2001053
Task: 4654

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ia95801a67b0db3932fba6b3dd0c4cae6f0a81e56

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ie33e01abfd695c100033ec1ede8f14fec98d4b36

commit_message:
Move wait_for_baremetal_node_lock to the baremetal proxy

It is a quite low-level method that regular users should not use. This patch
deprecates it in favor of new baremetal.wait_for_node_reservation.

Change-Id: I071bdea02898cf911c2c018d014895c8a856524c

commit_message:
Remove extra publish-openstack-python-branch-tarball job

With change https://review.openstack.org/609098 merged, we do not need
required-projects for publish-openstack-python-branch-tarball anymore.

The job can now be removed completely from the post pipeline since it
is part of the python-jobs template.

Change-Id: Iedca39a2ab7e2fdd565f9bb50c0c74f0b87b7536

commit_message:
Limit number of default swift server workers

'auto' defaults to the number of effective cpu cores and we should
cap the default max number using os_workers fact, unless overridden.

Change-Id: I59393a8d2d6aa13c386aea56da72b096ca672d4a

[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:47:54.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ie1638b8be77441f493c5feaf98c6ff9a52a86594
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ie1638b8be77441f493c5feaf98c6ff9a52a86594
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use the openstack-helm-lint job from central location

This moves the job definitions into a single location, the zuul.d
folder, like it is done in the openstack-helm-infra repository.

The job playbooks and definitions of this repository will be moved
away to the openstack-helm-infra repository in a later commit.

This patch implements the first job reuse with the job
openstack-helm-lint from openstack-helm-infra's repository.

Change-Id: I233da952548d69f040771007455955131139e860
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608662/

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ic870e30988317611afd168c69fed84607df6a3e7
Story: #2004073
Task: #27458
"}]
commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: Ic870e30988317611afd168c69fed84607df6a3e7
Story: #2004073
Task: #27458

commit_message:
Add guidelines for naming policies

Inconsistent policy names across OpenStack services has been a pain
point for operators and users for a long time. This is an attempt at
documenting a set of conventions for developers to work towards to
provide a more uniform experience. These conventions were discussed
publicly on the mailing list:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/134597.html

Change-Id: I8831c44a3544d11c0bb1c0ce58d1a140f861e22b

commit_message:
Wire in retries for all baremetal actions

The baremetal API can output HTTP 409 during its normal operation and
503 under load. This change enables retries for them.

Since node update can naturally result in HTTP 409, provide a way
to opt out of retrying on it. Additionally, allow retrying on HTTP 409
for all services via commit().

Change-Id: I765c4066e26706abe5f576c98353a48a17da6f9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-11 15:41:01.000000000', 'message': "Revert the Proxy metaclass

Sometimes one can be too clever. The win of generating methods here
doesn't really outweigh the complexity or the increased difficulty
understanding the codebase. Additionally, we run in to an EXCELLENTLY
obtuse error:

  TypeError: metaclass conflict: the metaclass of a derived class must be
  a (non-strict) subclass of the metaclasses of all its bases

when trying to make an abstract base class for the image proxy base
class.

Just get rid of the metaclass and restore the (very few) generated
methods.

Change-Id: Ib53d7b29526a734f1dcf4088bf156e9a29746f5b

"}]
commit_message:
Revert the Proxy metaclass

Sometimes one can be too clever. The win of generating methods here
doesn't really outweigh the complexity or the increased difficulty
understanding the codebase. Additionally, we run in to an EXCELLENTLY
obtuse error:

  TypeError: metaclass conflict: the metaclass of a derived class must be
  a (non-strict) subclass of the metaclasses of all its bases

when trying to make an abstract base class for the image proxy base
class.

Just get rid of the metaclass and restore the (very few) generated
methods.

Change-Id: Ib53d7b29526a734f1dcf4088bf156e9a29746f5b

commit_message:
Make it clear that OpenStackCloud is a mixin

It's not clear that this is a mixin. Make it clear. There was also a
documentation page that referenced it like it was a separate thing.
Remove that, since it's covered in the Connection docs.

Change-Id: I13bbf5155f7ee2aabe78ec93eb22175ec2403cfb

commit_message:
Start shifting cloud object-store methods to proxy

This doesn't do all of them because the task manager patches will merge
conflict if we do. But it gets the ball rolling.

Also, adds a skip_discovery attribute that can be set to avoid running
discovery for services, like object-store, for which that's never the
right choice.

Change-Id: I01d19119288cdd580b354b648f35b116818c349f

commit_message:
Remove all the deprecated stuff

We're really close to a 1.0 release. Let's go ahead and remove the stuff
that was marked deprecated and see what breaks.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/610695

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-23 17:18:57.000000000', 'message': "Speacial case network and use it in openstack.cloud

Doing discovery on neutron is a waste of time as there is only one
versions. They've put the unversioned endpoint into the catalog since
the beginning, but it's weird because neutronclient just appends /v2.0
unconditionally to the catalog url.

Even though it's gross, doing the same in openstacksdk means skipping
the extra discovery call when it's not needed. Of course, if someone
needs microversion info the call will be triggered.

Change-Id: If5f8b55a13a61b954f16712504aa8c34a66aeab1

Use network proxy in openstack.cloud

Stop creating our own client in the shade layer and use the sdk adapter.

Change-Id: If5f8b55a13a61b954f16712504aa8c34a66aeab1

commit_message:
tempest: cap max microversions for compute/volume APIs

This caps the max_microversion configuration for compute
and volume APIs in tempest for Rocky.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/rocky/reference/api-microversion-history.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/rocky/contributor/api_microversion_history.html

Change-Id: Id59ea9ef38feb81fcc02f1779a65bcf89fa7865b

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ia9cf4ec0b6cd5addb81dd1ff31d7e930040ddc44

commit_message:
Add NetworkPolicies resources to kuryr's CR

This commit adds resources required by NetworkPolicies support to
kuryr-controller ClusterRole. Without that we couldn't access them in
containerized deployments.

Change-Id: Id00ab1f040666a85d59413733540db73daa84563
Closes-Bug: 1796122

commit_message:
Add routes and multi-vif resources to Kuryr's CR

This commit adds routes and network-attachment-definitions resources to
kuryr-controller ClusterRole. Without that we wouldn't be able to access
them though ServiceAccount token, so features depending on those
wouldn't be working in containerized deployments.

Change-Id: Ifd0322b0ec7951d281fdae6e9e08c4356177b06d
Partial-Bug: 1796122

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-11 09:31:41.000000000', 'message': 'Always build requirements image in the pipeline

Without this patch, the loci builder automatically consumes a
previously published requirements image when the project is not
"requirements". This also means the first step in checks/gates
for non requirement images would be to pull a requirement.

Currently there is neither a "pipeline" nor consumption of
artifacts between jobs. Which means the "requirements" build
and the other image build have to be considered as independant.

However, by default, the "non-requirements" image built is
consuming previously published "requirements" image, but not
immediately previous built requirements image.

This is a problem, as it leaves us open to a race condition
where a new build of "requirements" and "non-requirements"
can succeed in a commit, but would cause all the next
"non-requirements" builds to fail, as it is possible the
newly published "requirements" to be incompatible with
the next "non-requirements", as they are not tested together.

This should fix the problem by ensuring that "requirements"
are always built and consumed in the "non-requirement"
building process, instead of re-using the previously built
requirements.

This will also allow new branches to be created, as there
would be no need of a previous build and publish
of requirements in the gating.

Change-Id: I093e4dfc0eef03c47d2d029011fdb5429242ae79

"requirements". This also means the first step in checks/gates

are always built and consumed in the "non-requirement"
building process, instead of re-using the previously built
requirements. For this, project needs to be overriden to
build the requirement image, and therefore a new profile
'requirements' was added to the buildargs of the distros.
Requirements repo also needs to be cloned in the gating
environment, and therefore was added to all the required
projects.

This will also allow new branches to be created, as there
would be no need of a previous build and publish
of requirements in the gating.

Change-Id: I093e4dfc0eef03c47d2d029011fdb5429242ae79

commit_message:
Always build requirements image in the pipeline

Without this patch, the loci builder automatically consumes a
previously published requirements image when the project is not
"requirements". This also means the first step in checks/gates
for non requirement images would be to pull a requirement.

Currently there is neither a "pipeline" nor consumption of
artifacts between jobs. Which means the "requirements" build
and the other image build have to be considered as independant.

However, by default, the "non-requirements" image built is
consuming previously published "requirements" image, but not
immediately previous built requirements image.

This is a problem, as it leaves us open to a race condition
where a new build of "requirements" and "non-requirements"
can succeed in a commit, but would cause all the next
"non-requirements" builds to fail, as it is possible the
newly published "requirements" to be incompatible with
the next "non-requirements", as they are not tested together.

This should fix the problem by ensuring that "requirements"
are always built and consumed in the "non-requirement"
building process, instead of re-using the previously built
requirements. For this, project needs to be overriden to
build the requirement image, and therefore a new profile
'requirements' was added to the buildargs of the distros.
Requirements repo also needs to be cloned in the gating
environment, and therefore was added to all the required
projects.

This will also allow new branches to be created, as there
would be no need of a previous build and publish
of requirements in the gating.

Change-Id: I093e4dfc0eef03c47d2d029011fdb5429242ae79

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:48:08.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ifff1ad9627e0f369e99b90ab9deea3f12a661b36
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ifff1ad9627e0f369e99b90ab9deea3f12a661b36
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
list_servers pagination support

If we want to list the servers of a deployment with more servers than
nova.conf max_limit, currently we only return max_limit. This patch
makes it behave as expected, getting you all the servers.

Change-Id: I58844125ba37d81f1611e4e8ec641c1b8573884d
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-15 11:48:25.000000000', 'message': 'Remove dependency to OSH repository for test jobs

Without this patch, there is a dependency between the two
repositories OSH and OSH-addons, which will cause a circular
dependency problem when trying to remove the duplicated jobs
that will appear in OSH.

Change-Id: Id782060bd95a78843f64380dd739fa59ccbf7ce8
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency to OSH repository for test jobs

Without this patch, there is a dependency between the two
repositories OSH and OSH-addons, which will cause a circular
dependency problem when trying to remove the duplicated jobs
that will appear in OSH.

Change-Id: Id782060bd95a78843f64380dd739fa59ccbf7ce8

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Icb45d2212f4d6a471b5a423b62a6db7b91072c37

commit_message:
Parse envelope fields from kafka to prepare the ES index

- Change the default index prefix name for events.

Story: 2003955
Task: 26880

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I0ec6d6877f3518f267a977effb4e9d32a7300b89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ieedc08b9dcb3781439c8928059f6304dea3bb229
Story: #2004073
Task: #27432

Drop python-six from the list of packages to install/purge on
upgrade to py3 workload execution.

This was a legacy requirement in obsolete packaging versions

commit_message:
py3: Don't purge or install python-six

Drop python-six from the list of packages to install/purge on
upgrade to py3 workload execution.

This was a legacy requirement in obsolete packaging versions
of Nova.

Purging six has the side effect of removing crmsh from the unit
in clustered deployments.

Change-Id: I9dfe7b031562c8f3e85445486ba16b3c7b2465ca

subject: Remove rhel-registration scripts and resources.
messages:
[{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-15 11:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-15 13:40:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I wouldn't drop these files yet, as we haven't found a way yet to run the replace DeleteOnRHELUnregistration in RHSM with Ansible.

In other words, the rhel-registration is still useful when scaling down an overcloud so the unregistration is done automatically.

We documented this limitation : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/592005/1/doc/source/install/advanced_deployment/rhsm.rst
Until we haven't addressed that, I wouldn't remove these files."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-10-16 12:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandon until the unregistration after scaling down will be solved'}]

commit_message:
Remove rhel-registration scripts and resources.

Included in Queens, the new Rhsm [0] service is the
way to accomplish node registration when using
satellite or portal. This patch removes the old
rhel-registration folder to avoid its use.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/queens/extraconfig/services/rhsm.yaml

Change-Id: I55fec422479c35c4842f7e03e3832cd96e9a4ef6
